attributes.action: Stop the use of unfounded statistics in debates in the House of Commons.
attributes.additional_details: See https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/110444 for the original rejected petition. (Due to a lack of specificity).
attributes.background: The use of unfounded statistics can have a huge sway on the general population, and hence a massive effect on policy making. A clause should be introduced into the Code of Conduct for MPs to stop this from happening and negatively affecting the decisions made in parliament.
